channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Datchelor Place is for pedestrians. These bikes are blocking access to the planting . Move them or they will be removed, 27th February
item.description:
Not acceptable. Move them now

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Datchelor Place, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned car, 27th February
item.description:
Car has been parked here for approximately 8 weeks. Surrounding neighbour's all say it does not belong to any of them and has possibly been there longer than 8 weeks. Registration KN56 RJJ Silver mercedes. No model on car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kentish Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous bags of rubbish were left in the street, 27th February
item.description:
The contents of the van were observed being discarded onto the pavement on the morning of 27th February around 11:22 where they currently remain.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Great Guildford Street, The Borough, Greater London

item.title: Graffiti on Junction Box, no.36 Tollbridge Close Canal Towpath Side, 27th February
item.description:
Graffiti on Junction Box, no.36 Tollbridge Close Canal Towpath Side

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27-77, Tollbridge Close, North Kensington, Greater London

item.title: Motor garaged and repairing of vehicles on public road., 27th February
item.description:
This problem has been there for years. Four motor garages and tyre mart in this small residential avenue. Noisy, dirty abusive environment. Not bothered about the residents. In addition illegal repair on our public road not at all worried about the law and order. We wonder where the traffic warden is when these are happening. Untaxed vehicles are parked and repaired and the very next minute I report to the authorities, the vehicles go missing?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Park Avenue, Edmonton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation, 27th February
item.description:
Overhanging vegetation from Railway all the way fence line, causes rats and isn’t pleasant
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 113, Seymour Villas, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three large pothols, 27th February
item.description:
On the approach to the roundabout near the doctors surgery on kings Harold way there is three large potholes simultaneously and are becoming larger and harder to avoid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): King Harolds Way, West Heath, Greater London

item.title: Old carpet and laundry rack, 27th February
item.description:
These neighbours keep leaving rubbish outside their house. Please can you write to them and ask them not to leave rubbish outside their house please. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 103, Abbey Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: Road pot holes by bus stop, 27th February
item.description:

item.title: The paved area which is large at the junction of Goddard Road, 27th February
item.description:
This area could be greatly improved with the addition of hanging planters or large planters filled with flowers, this is an unused area that could even have some benches/seating with huge planters. It could be a more communal stop for local residents to chat and enjoy
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamppost, 27th February
item.description:
Lamp post very temperamental and dim light please come this road section be adjusted all lights renewed as there is a lot of activities in this area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beaconsfield Road, Mottingham, Greater London

item.title: This area at the turning junction of Goddard Road is muddy grass, 27th February
item.description:
This are is a mess and needs planting, the junction is busy and some planting here flowers etc will improve the area and raise the look of the area, the elm tree makes a great effort to improve the look of our area and planting here will do the same
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goddard Road, Elmers End, Greater London

item.title: Street Light not working, 27th February
item.description:

item.title: There is rubbish all through the bushes from the bus stop area s d all way round the perimeter of Tesco to the bus terminal it’s full of rubbish leaves and needs weeding and cutting, 27th February
